# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/pygments/formatters/_mapping.py
@source-hash: d42c37ec5b9094d6
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:57:22Z

## Purpose
Auto-generated mapping file that defines all available Pygments formatters and their metadata. Serves as a central registry for formatter discovery and instantiation within the Pygments syntax highlighting library.

## Key Data Structure
- **FORMATTERS** (L4-23): Dictionary mapping formatter class names to 5-tuple metadata:
  - Module path (string): Where the formatter class is defined
  - Display name (string): Human-readable formatter name  
  - Aliases (tuple): Short names for CLI/API access
  - File extensions (tuple): Associated file patterns
  - Description (string): Formatter purpose and usage notes

## Formatter Categories
- **Text Output**: NullFormatter, RawTokenFormatter, TestcaseFormatter (L14, 16, 22)
- **Terminal Output**: TerminalFormatter, Terminal256Formatter, TerminalTrueColorFormatter (L20-21)
- **Markup Formats**: HtmlFormatter, LatexFormatter, RtfFormatter, BBCodeFormatter (L9, 13, 17, 5)
- **Image Formats**: ImageFormatter, BmpImageFormatter, GifImageFormatter, JpgImageFormatter (L11, 6, 7, 12)
- **Vector Graphics**: SvgFormatter (L18)
- **Specialized**: IRCFormatter, GroffFormatter, PangoMarkupFormatter (L10, 8, 15)

## Dependencies
- Generated by `scripts/gen_mapfiles.py` - modification requires regeneration via `tox -e mapfiles`
- Referenced formatter modules span `pygments.formatters.*` subpackages
- PIL (Python Imaging Library) required for image formatters

## Architecture Notes
- Static mapping enables lazy loading of formatter classes
- Tuple structure provides consistent metadata access pattern
- Aliases support flexible formatter selection in APIs
- File extension associations enable automatic format detection
